intro: Lobelia christii, commonly known as the Christ's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Lobelia christii is part of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
